column7:
-----

-----

-----
## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

-----

-----
Sorry, I dint see you message.
Can you send me a screen shot?
I run one. Things are quite alright. Only problem I could found out is small responsive problem thats moving litle more left and little less in right side. Other than that its perfectly alright.
I have to go - I will be back in about an hour.
I have a favor to ask of you. Could you try working through some of our challenges on your phone, and tell us  anything that annoys you, or prevents you from advancing?
Scrolling is excellent
OK - I’m not sure why that is (I can see whether it’s like that on my iPhone).
That's true!
Loading speed is excellent. It loads within 2 sec.
Yes - you can scroll left and right a bit?
I think first thing is, page is not responsive. It doesn't perfectly fit on the device screen.
Sir, I am using old Samsung S4 and so many things does not work in this my mobile. If I give you some report it might mislead the project.
Please type any problems you may have here, and we can start creating issues for it.
How long does it take for a page to load? Do the tests run properly? Are you able to scroll around and see everything you need to see easily enough.

When you have time, could you try it out?
Here’s what we want to know - what are the biggest problems with doing Free Code Camp on a mobile phone?
I did not really try that out.
@pritamkumarshahi did you ever try to use Free Code Camp on your mobile phone?
Coding on a phone will never be as convenient as coding on a laptop. But we should do what we can to make it possible.
I have heard reports from other campers that they are completing Free Code Camp on their phone, and that it is very inconvenient to do so.
So many people will be benefited for sure.
Sir, its really a great initiative .

I created this room after reading @pritamkumarshahi’s story earlier today (https://www.quora.com/How-does-it-feel-to-be-extremely-poor/answer/Pritam-Kumar-99)
One thing that stood out to me about what he said was that he wasn’t able to buy even a used laptop, and had to resort to paying to use an internet cafe so that he could work on Free Code Camp challenges.
